definition: The compass direction the exterior window of the room is facing

label: presence of pets, animals, or insects
definition: The type and number of animals or insects present in the sampling space.

label: quadrant position
definition: The quadrant position of the sampling room within the building

label: relative sampling location
definition: The sampling location within the train car
valueSyntax: [edge of car|center of car|under a seat]

label: room condition
definition: The condition of the room at the time of sampling

label: room location in building
definition: The position of the room within the building

label: room sampling position
definition: The horizontal sampling position in the room relative to architectural elements
valueSyntax: [north corner|south corner|west corner|east corner|northeast corner|northwest corner|southeast corner|southwest corner|center]

label: room type
definition: The main purpose or activity of the sampling room. A room is any distinguishable space within a structure
valueSyntax: [attic|bathroom|closet|conference room|elevator|examining room|hallway|kitchen|mail room|private office|open office|stairwell|,restroom|lobby|vestibule|mechanical or electrical room|data center|laboratory_wet|laboratory_dry|gymnasium|natatorium|auditorium|lockers|cafe|warehouse]

label: rooms connected by a doorway
definition: List of rooms connected to the sampling room by a doorway

label: sampling day weather
definition: The weather on the sampling day

label: sampling floor
definition: The floor of the building, where the sampling room is located

label: season
definition: The season when sampling occurred. Any of the four periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices. This field accepts terms listed under season (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C94729).

label: seasonal use
definition: The seasons the space is occupied

label: shading device condition
definition: The physical condition of the shading device at the time of sampling

label: shading device location
definition: The location of the shading device in relation to the built structure

label: heating system identifier
definition: The heating system identifier

label: shading device signs of water/mold
definition: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the shading device
valueSyntax: [presence of mold visible|no presence of mold visible]

label: shading device type
definition: The type of shading device
valueSyntax: [bahama shutters|exterior roll blind|gambrel awning|hood awning|porchroller awning|sarasota shutters|slatted aluminum|solid aluminum awning|sun screen|tree|trellis|venetian awning]

label: specifications
definition: The building specifications. If design is chosen, indicate phase: conceptual, schematic, design development, construction documents

label: train line
definition: The subway line name

label: train station collection location
definition: The train station collection location
valueSyntax: [south station above ground|south station underground|south station amtrak|forest hills|riverside]

label: train stop collection location
definition: The train stop collection location

label: visual media
definition: The building visual media
valueSyntax: [photos|videos|commonly of the building|site context (adjacent buildings, vegetation, terrain, streets)|interiors|equipment|3D scans]

label: wall construction type
definition: The building class of the wall defined by the composition of the building elements and fire-resistance rating.
valueSyntax: [frame construction|joisted masonry|light noncombustible|masonry noncombustible|modified fire resistive|fire resistive]

label: wall finish material
definition: The material utilized to finish the outer most layer of the wall

label: wall location
definition: The relative location of the wall within the room

label: wall signs of water/mold
definition: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on a wall
valueSyntax: [presence of mold visible|no presence of mold visible]

label: wall surface treatment
definition: The surface treatment of interior wall

label: wall texture
definition: The feel, appearance, or consistency of a wall surface
valueSyntax: [crows feet|crows-foot stomp||double skip|hawk and trowel|knockdown|popcorn|orange peel|rosebud stomp|Santa-Fe texture|skip trowel|smooth|stomp knockdown|swirl]

label: water feature type
definition: The type of water feature present within the building being sampled

label: weekday
definition: The day of the week when sampling occurred

label: window condition
definition: The physical condition of the window at the time of sampling

label: window covering
definition: The type of window covering

label: window horizontal position
definition: The horizontal position of the window on the wall

label: window location
definition: The relative location of the window within the room

label: window material
definition: The type of material used to finish a window

label: window signs of water/mold
definition: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the window.
valueSyntax: [presence of mold visible|no presence of mold visible]

label: window status
definition: Defines whether the windows were open or closed during environmental testing

label: window type
definition: The type of windows

label: window vertical position
definition: The vertical position of the window on the wall

label: biological status
definition: The level of genome modification.

label: genetic modification
definition: Genetic modifications of the genome of an organism, which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means, e.g. specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection

label: sample capture status
definition: Reason for the sample
valueSyntax: [active surveillance in response to an outbreak|active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak|farm sample|market sample|other]

label: host subject id
definition: A unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified.

label: host sex
definition: Physical sex of the host.
expectedValue: sex of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples); enumeration

label: host body habitat
definition: Original body habitat where the sample was obtained from

label: host body site
definition: Name of body site where the sample was obtained from, such as a specific organ or tissue (tongue, lung etc...). For foundational model of anatomy ontology (fma) (v 4.11.0) or Uber-anatomy ontology (UBERON) (v releases/2014-06-15) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/FMA or http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/UBERON

label: host body product
definition: Substance produced by the body, e.g. Stool, mucus, where the sample was obtained from. For foundational model of anatomy ontology (fma) or Uber-anatomy ontology (UBERON) terms, please see https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/fma or https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/uberon.
expectedValue: body substance of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples) where the samples was obtained from; FMA or UBERON

label: host diet
definition: Type of diet depending on the host, for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, meditteranean etc.; can include multiple diet types

label: host last meal
definition: Content of last meal and time since feeding; can include multiple values

label: host growth conditions
definition: Literature reference giving growth conditions of the host

label: host family relationship
definition: Familial relationships to other hosts in the same study; can include multiple relationships

label: host phenotype
definition: Phenotype of human or other host. For phenotypic quality ontology (pato) (v 2018-03-27) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/pato. For Human Phenotype Ontology (HP) (v 2018-06-13) please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/HP

label: gravidity
definition: Whether or not subject is gravid, and if yes date due or date post-conception, specifying which is used

label: IHMC medication code
definition: Can include multiple medication codes

label: host body product
definition: Substance produced by the body, e.g. Stool, mucus, where the sample was obtained from. For foundational model of anatomy ontology (fma) or Uber-anatomy ontology (UBERON) terms, please see https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/fma or https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/uberon

label: drug usage
definition: Any drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple drugs used

label: ethnicity
definition: A category of people who identify with each other, usually on the basis of presumed similarities such as a common language, ancestry, history, society, culture, nation or social treatment within their residing area. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_contemporary_ethnic_groups

label: host occupation
definition: Most frequent job performed by subject

label: medical history performed
definition: Whether full medical history was collected

label: study completion status
definition: Specification of study completion status, if no the reason should be specified
expectedValue: YES or NO due to (1)adverse event (2) non-compliance (3) lost to follow up (4)other-specify

label: urine/collection method
definition: Specification of urine collection method

label: special diet
definition: Specification of special diet; can include multiple special diets

label: time since last toothbrushing
definition: Specification of the time since last toothbrushing

label: time since last wash
definition: Specification of the time since last wash

label: dominant hand
definition: Dominant hand of the subject

label: menarche
definition: Date of most recent menstruation

label: pregnancy
definition: Date due of pregnancy

label: douche
definition: Date of most recent douche

label: menopause
definition: Date of onset of menopause

label: HRT
definition: Whether subject had hormone replacement theraphy, and if yes start date

label: hydrocarbon resource type
definition: Main Hydrocarbon Resource type. The term Hydrocarbon Resource HCR defined as a natural environmental feature containing large amounts of hydrocarbons at high concentrations potentially suitable for commercial exploitation. This term should not be confused with the Hydrocarbon Occurrence term which also includes hydrocarbon-rich environments with currently limited commercial interest such as seeps, outcrops, gas hydrates etc. If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field
valueSyntax: [Oil Reservoir|Gas Reservoir|Oil Sand|Coalbed|Shale|Tight Oil Reservoir|Tight Gas Reservoir|other]

label: hydrocarbon type produced
definition: Main hydrocarbon type produced from resource (i.e. Oil, gas, condensate, etc). If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field

label: lithology
definition: Hydrocarbon resource main lithology (Additional information: http://petrowiki.org/Lithology_and_rock_type_determination). If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field

label: depositional environment
definition: Main depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depositional_environment). If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field
valueSyntax: [Continental - Alluvial|Continental - Aeolian|Continental - Fluvial|Continental - Lacustrine|Transitional - Deltaic|Transitional - Tidal|Transitional - Lagoonal|Transitional - Beach|Transitional - Lake|Marine - Shallow|Marine - Deep|Marine - Reef|Other - Evaporite|Other - Glacial|Other - Volcanic|other]

label: hydrocarbon resource geological age
definition: Geological age of hydrocarbon resource (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field

label: source rock kerogen type
definition: Origin of kerogen. Type I: Algal (aquatic), Type II: planktonic and soft plant material (aquatic or terrestrial), Type III: terrestrial woody/ fibrous plant material (terrestrial), Type IV: oxidized recycled woody debris (terrestrial) (additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerogen). If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field

label: source rock lithology
definition: Lithology of source rock (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_rock). If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field

label: source rock depositional environment
definition: Source rock depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_rock). If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field

label: source rock geological age
definition: Geological age of source rock (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field

label: sample type
definition: The type of material from which the sample was obtained. For the Hydrocarbon package, samples include types like core, rock trimmings, drill cuttings, piping section, coupon, pigging debris, solid deposit, produced fluid, produced water, injected water, swabs, etc. For the Food Package, samples are usually categorized as food, body products or tissues, or environmental material. This field accepts terms listed under environmental specimen (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001246).

label: sample subtype
definition: Name of sample sub-type. For example if sample type is Produced Water then subtype could be Oil Phase or Water Phase. If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field

label: pH
definition: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid

label: production start date
definition: Date of field's first production

label: secondary and tertiary recovery methods and start date
definition: Additional (i.e. Secondary, tertiary, etc.) recovery methods deployed for increase of hydrocarbon recovery from resource and start date for each one of them. If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field
valueSyntax: [Water Injection|Dump Flood|Gas Injection|Wag Immiscible Injection|Polymer Addition|Surfactant Addition|Not Applicable|other];{timestamp}

label: injection water breakthrough date of specific well
definition: Injection water breakthrough date per well following a secondary and/or tertiary recovery

label: biocide administration
definition: List of biocides (commercial name of product and supplier) and date of administration

label: chemical treatment
definition: List of chemical compounds administered upstream the sampling location where sampling occurred (e.g. Glycols, H2S scavenger, corrosion and scale inhibitors, demulsifiers, and other production chemicals etc.). The commercial name of the product and name of the supplier should be provided. The date of administration should also be included

label: sample collection point
definition: Sampling point on the asset were sample was collected (e.g. Wellhead, storage tank, separator, etc). If other is specified, please propose entry in additional info field

label: biotic regimen
definition: Information about treatment(s) involving use of biotic factors, such as bacteria, viruses or fungi.
example: sample inoculated with Rhizobium spp. Culture

label: climate environment
definition: Treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple climates

label: culture rooting medium
definition: Name or reference for the hydroponic or in vitro culture rooting medium; can be the name of a commonly used medium or reference to a specific medium, e.g. Murashige and Skoog medium. If the medium has not been formally published, use the rooting medium descriptors.

label: growth facility
definition: Type of facility where the sampled plant was grown; controlled vocabulary: growth chamber, open top chamber, glasshouse, experimental garden, field. Alternatively use Crop Ontology (CO) terms, see http://www.cropontology.org/ontology/CO_715/Crop%20Research

label: growth habit
definition: Characteristic shape, appearance or growth form of a plant species

label: mechanical damage
definition: Information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites

label: pH regimen
definition: Information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of ph of the growth media, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimen

label: plant growth medium
definition: Specification of the media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples, e.g. soil, aeroponic, hydroponic, in vitro solid culture medium, in vitro liquid culture medium. Recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium (follow this link for terms http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/EO_0007147) or other controlled vocabulary
valueSyntax: {termLabel} {[termID]} or [husk|other artificial liquid medium|other artificial solid medium|peat moss|perlite|pumice|sand|soil|vermiculite|water]

label: plant product
definition: Substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from

label: plant sex
definition: Sex of the reproductive parts on the whole plant, e.g. pistillate, staminate, monoecieous, hermaphrodite.

label: plant structure
definition: Name of plant structure the sample was obtained from; for Plant Ontology (PO) (v releases/2017-12-14) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. petiole epidermis (PO_0000051). If an individual flower is sampled, the sex of it can be recorded here.

label: rooting conditions
definition: Relevant rooting conditions such as field plot size, sowing density, container dimensions, number of plants per container.

label: rooting medium pH
definition: pH measurement of the culture rooting medium; e.g. 5.5.

label: rooting medium solidifier
definition: Specification of the solidifying agent in the culture rooting medium; e.g. agar.

label: seasonal environment
definition: Treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. Winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.), treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment
expectedValue: seasonal environment name;treatment interval and duration

label: standing water regimen
definition: Treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
expectedValue: standing water type;treatment interval and duration

label: tissue culture growth media
definition: Description of plant tissue culture growth media used

label: sediment type
definition: Information about the sediment type based on major constituents

label: current land use
definition: Present state of sample site
valueSyntax: [cities|farmstead|industrial areas|roads/railroads|rock|sand|gravel|mudflats|salt flats|badlands|permanent snow or ice|saline seeps|mines/quarries|oil waste areas|small grains|row crops|vegetable crops|horticultural plants (e.g. tulips)|marshlands (grass,sedges,rushes)|tundra (mosses,lichens)|rangeland|pastureland (grasslands used for livestock grazing)|hayland|meadows (grasses,alfalfa,fescue,bromegrass,timothy)|shrub land (e.g. mesquite,sage-brush,creosote bush,shrub oak,eucalyptus)|successional shrub land (tree saplings,hazels,sumacs,chokecherry,shrub dogwoods,blackberries)|shrub crops (blueberries,nursery ornamentals,filberts)|vine crops (grapes)|conifers (e.g. pine,spruce,fir,cypress)|hardwoods (e.g. oak,hickory,elm,aspen)|intermixed hardwood and conifers|tropical (e.g. mangrove,palms)|rainforest (evergreen forest receiving >406 cm annual rainfall)|swamp (permanent or semi-permanent water body dominated by woody plants)|crop trees (nuts,fruit,christmas trees,nursery trees)]

label: history/tillage
definition: Note method(s) used for tilling

label: soil horizon
definition: Specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath
valueSyntax: [O horizon|A horizon|E horizon|B horizon|C horizon|R layer|Permafrost]

label: soil_taxonomic/FAO classification
definition: Soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources. The list can be found at http://www.fao.org/nr/land/sols/soil/wrb-soil-maps/reference-groups

label: profile position
definition: Cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas

label: drainage classification
definition: Drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

label: history/fire
definition: Historical and/or physical evidence of fire

label: atmospheric data
definition: Measurement of atmospheric data; can include multiple data

label: pH method
definition: Reference or method used in determining ph

label: sample name
definition: A local identifier or name that for the material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. It can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible. INSDC requires every sample name from a single Submitter to be unique. Use of a globally unique identifier for the field source_mat_id is recommended in addition to sample_name.

label: growth medium
definition: A liquid or gel containing nutrients, salts, and other factors formulated to support the growth of microorganisms, cells, or plants (National Cancer Institute Thesaurus).  The name of the medium used to grow the microorganism.

label: farm watering water source
definition: Source of water used on the farm for irrigation of crops or watering of livestock.

label: plant water delivery method
definition: Description of the equipment or method used to distribute water to crops. This field accepts termed listed under irrigation process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000006). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

label: animal feeding equipment
definition: Description of the feeding equipment used for livestock. This field accepts terms listed under feed delivery (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001757). Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

label: animal intrusion near sample source
definition: Identification of animals intruding on the sample or sample site including invertebrates (such as pests or pollinators) and vertebrates (such as wildlife or domesticated animals). This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

label: animal water delivery method
definition: Description of the equipment or method used to distribute water to livestock. This field accepts termed listed under water delivery equipment (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001653). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

label: crop yield
definition: Amount of crop produced per unit or area of land.

label: culture result
definition: Any result of a bacterial culture experiment reported as a binary assessment such as positive/negative, active/inactive.

label: culture result organism
definition: Taxonomic information about the cultured organism(s).

label: culture target microbial analyte
definition: The target microbial analyte in terms of investigation scope. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy.
expectedValue: NCIT:C14250 or NCBI taxid or culture independent

label: degree of plant part maturity
definition: A description of the stage of development of a plant or plant part based on maturity or ripeness. This field accepts terms listed under degree of plant maturity (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530050).

label: environment adjacent to site
definition: Description of the environmental system or features that are adjacent to the sampling site. This field accepts terms under ecosystem (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001110) and human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

label: environmental feature adjacent water source
definition: Description of the environmental features that are adjacent to the farm water source. This field accepts terms under ecosystem (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001110) and human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

label: equipment shared with other farms
definition: List of planting, growing or harvesting equipment shared with other farms. This field accepts terms listed under agricultural implement (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000416). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

label: farm equipment sanitization
definition: Method used to sanitize growing and harvesting equipment. This can including type and concentration of sanitizing solution.  Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.
expectedValue: text or commercial name of sanitizer or class of sanitizer or active ingredient in sanitizer
example: hot water pressure wash, hypochlorite solution, 50 parts per million

label: farm equipment sanitization frequency
definition: The number of times farm equipment is cleaned. Frequency of cleaning might be on a Daily basis, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly or Annually.

label: farm equipment used
definition: List of equipment used for planting, fertilization, harvesting, irrigation, land levelling, residue management, weeding or transplanting during the growing season.  This field accepts terms listed under agricultural implement (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000416). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

label: fertilizer administration
definition: Type of fertilizer or amendment added to the soil or water for the purpose of improving substrate health and quality for plant growth. This field accepts terms listed under agronomic fertilizer (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00002062). Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes, listing in reverse chronological order.

label: fertilizer administration date
definition: Date of administration of soil amendment or fertilizer. Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes, listing in reverse chronological order.

label: food animal group size
definition: The number of food animals of the same species that are maintained together as a unit, i.e. a herd or flock.

label: food animal source diet
definition: If the isolate is from a food animal, the type of diet eaten by the food animal.  Please list the main food staple and the setting, if appropriate.  For a list of acceptable animal feed terms or categories, please see http://www.feedipedia.org.  Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes |Food product for animal covers foods intended for consumption by domesticated animals. Consult http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03309997. If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food type. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes. If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food product type.

label: food contact surface
definition: The specific container or coating materials in direct contact with the food. Multiple values can be assigned.  This field accepts terms listed under food contact surface (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03500010).

label: food container or wrapping
definition: Type of container or wrapping defined by the main container material, the container form, and the material of the liner lids or ends. Also type of container or wrapping by form; prefer description by material first, then by form. This field accepts terms listed under food container or wrapping (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03490100).

label: Food harvesting process
definition: A harvesting process is a process which takes in some food material from an individual or community of plant or animal organisms in a given context and time, and outputs a precursor or consumable food product. This may include a part of an organism or the whole, and may involve killing the organism.

label: food packing medium
definition: The medium in which the food is packed for preservation and handling or the medium surrounding homemade foods, e.g., peaches cooked in sugar syrup. The packing medium may provide a controlled environment for the food. It may also serve to improve palatability and consumer appeal.  This includes edible packing media (e.g. fruit juice), gas other than air (e.g. carbon dioxide), vacuum packed, or packed with aerosol propellant. This field accepts terms under food packing medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03480020). Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes.

label: food preservation process
definition: The methods contributing to the prevention or retardation of microbial, enzymatic or oxidative spoilage and thus to the extension of shelf life. This field accepts terms listed under food preservation process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03470107).

label: food production characteristics
definition: Descriptors of the food production system such as wild caught, free-range, organic, free-range, industrial, dairy, beef.

label: food shipping transportation method
definition: A descriptor for the method of movement of food commodity along the food distribution system.  This field accepts terms listed under travel mode (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001064). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

label: Food shipping transportation vehicle
definition: A descriptor for the mobile machine which is used to transport food commodities along the food distribution system.  This field accepts terms listed under vehicle (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01000604). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

label: food source
definition: Type of plant or animal from which the food product or its major ingredient is derived or a chemical food source [FDA CFSAN 1995].

label: food treatment process
definition: Used to specifically characterize a food product based on the treatment or processes applied to the product or any indexed ingredient. The processes include adding, substituting or removing components or modifying the food or component, e.g., through fermentation. Multiple values can be assigned. This fields accepts terms listed under food treatment process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03460111).

label: extreme weather event
definition: Unusual weather events that may have affected microbial populations. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, listed in reverse chronological order.

label: extreme weather date
definition: Date of unusual weather events that may have affected microbial populations. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, listed in reverse chronological order.

label: intended consumer
definition: Food consumer type, human or animal, for which the food product is produced and marketed. This field accepts terms listed under food consumer group (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510136) or NCBI taxid.

label: library preparation kit
definition: Packaged kits (containing adapters, indexes, enzymes, buffers etc.), tailored for specific sequencing workflows, which allow the simplified preparation of sequencing-ready libraries for small genomes, amplicons, and plasmids.

label: local air flow impediments
definition: Presence of objects in the area that would influence or impede air flow through the air filter.
expectedValue: enumeration;obstruction type; distance from sampling device

label: lot number
definition: A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product within a batch. Synonym: Batch Number.  The submitter should provide lot number of the item followed by the item name for which the lot number was provided.

label: mean seasonal humidity
definition: Average humidity of the region throughout the growing season.

label: part of plant or animal
definition: The anatomical part of the organism being involved in food production or consumption; e.g., a carrot is the root of the plant (root vegetable). This field accepts terms listed under part of plant or animal (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03420116).

label: plant reproductive part
definition: Plant reproductive part used in the field during planting to start the crop.

label: purpose of sampling
definition: The reason that the sample was collected.
valueSyntax: [active surveillance in response to an outbreak|active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak|clinical trial|cluster investigation|environmental assessment|farm sample|field trial|for cause|industry internal investigation|market sample|passive surveillance|population based studies|research|research and development] or {text}

label: repository name
definition: The name of the institution where the sample or DNA extract is held or sample not available if the sample was used in its entirety for analysis or otherwise not retained.

label: sample pooling
definition: Physical combination of several instances of like material, e.g. RNA extracted from samples or dishes of cell cultures into one big aliquot of cells. Please provide a short description of the samples that were pooled.
example: 5uL of extracted genomic DNA from 5 leaves were pooled

label: sample source material category
definition: This is the scientific role or category that the subject organism or material has with respect to an investigation.  This field accepts terms listed under specimen source material category (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001237 or http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0100051).

label: sequencing kit
definition: Pre-filled, ready-to-use reagent cartridges. Used to produce improved chemistry, cluster density and read length as well as improve quality (Q) scores. Reagent components are encoded to interact with the sequencing system to validate compatibility with user-defined applications. Indicate name of the sequencing kit.
example: NextSeq 500/550 High Output Kit v2.5 (75 Cycles)

label: sequencing location
definition: The location the sequencing run was performed. Indicate the name of the lab or core facility where samples were sequenced.
example: University of Maryland Genomics Resource Center

label: serovar or serotype
definition: A characterization of a cell or microorganism based on the antigenic properties of the molecules on its surface. Indicate the name of a serovar or serotype of interest. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy.

label: soil conductivity
definition: Conductivity of soil at time of sampling.

label: soil cover
definition: Description of the material covering the sampled soil. This field accepts terms under ENVO:00010483, environmental material.

label: soil pH
definition: The pH of soil at time of sampling.

label: relative location of sample
definition: Location of sampled soil to other parts of the farm e.g. under crop plant, near irrigation ditch, from the dirt road.

label: soil sediment porosity
definition: Porosity of soil or deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample.

label: soil temperature
definition: Temperature of soil at the time of sampling.

label: soil texture classification
definition: One of the 12 soil texture classes use to describe soil texture based on the relative proportion of different grain sizes  of mineral particles [sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um)] in a soil.
valueSyntax: [clay|clay loam|loam|loamy sand|sand|sandy clay|sandy clay loam|sandy loam|silt|silty clay|silty clay loam|silt loam]

label: spike in organism
definition: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s). This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

label: spike-in bacterial serovar or serotype
definition: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s) at the serovar or serotype level. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.
expectedValue: NCIT:C14250 or antigenic formula or serovar name

label: spike-in growth medium
definition: A liquid or gel containing nutrients, salts, and other factors formulated to support the growth of microorganisms, cells, or plants (National Cancer Institute Thesaurus).  A growth medium is a culture medium which has the disposition to encourage growth of particular bacteria to the exclusion of others in the same growth environment.  In this case, list the culture medium used to propagate the spike-in bacteria during preparation of spike-in inoculum. This field accepts terms listed under microbiological culture medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MICRO_0000067). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the spike in growth media.

label: spike-in microbial strain
definition: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s) at the strain level. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.
expectedValue: NCIT:C14250 or NCBI taxid or text

label: spike-in with antibiotics
definition: Antimicrobials used in research study to assess effects of exposure on microbiome of a specific site.  Please list antimicrobial, common name and/or class and concentration used for spike-in.

label: spike-in with heavy metals
definition: Heavy metals used in research study to assess effects of exposure on microbiome of a specific site.  Please list heavy metals and concentration used for spike-in.
expectedValue: heavy metal name or chemical symbol; concentration

label: timepoint
definition: Time point at which a sample or observation is made or taken from a biomaterial as measured from some reference point. Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format.

label: water delivery frequency
definition: Number of water delivery events within a given period of time.
preferredUnit: per day, per week, per month

label: water pH
definition: pH measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid.

label: water source shared
definition: Other users sharing access to the same water source. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

label: enrichment protocol
definition: The microbiological workflow or protocol followed to test for the presence or enumeration of the target microbial analyte(s). Please provide a PubMed or DOI reference for published protocols.
example: BAM Chapter 4: Enumeration of Escherichia coli and the Coliform Bacteria

label: food quality date
definition: The date recommended for the use of the product while at peak quality, this date is not a reflection of safety unless used on infant formula this date is not a reflection of safety and is typically labeled on a food product as best if used by, best by, use by, or freeze by.
valueSyntax: [best by|best if used by|freeze by||use by]; date

label: Interagency Food Safety Analytics Collaboration (IFSAC) category
definition: The IFSAC food categorization scheme has five distinct levels to which foods can be assigned, depending upon the type of food. First, foods are assigned to one of four food groups (aquatic animals, land animals, plants, and other). Food groups include increasingly specific food categories; dairy, eggs, meat and poultry, and game are in the land animal food group, and the category meat and poultry is further subdivided into more specific categories of meat (beef, pork, other meat) and poultry (chicken, turkey, other poultry). Finally, foods are differentiated by differences in food processing (such as pasteurized fluid dairy products, unpasteurized fluid dairy products, pasteurized solid and semi-solid dairy products, and unpasteurized solid and semi-solid dairy products. An IFSAC food category chart is available from https://www.cdc.gov/foodsafety/ifsac/projects/food-categorization-scheme.html PMID: 28926300.

label: animal housing system
definition: Description of the housing system of the livestock. This field accepts terms listed under terrestrial management housing system (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001605).

label: culture isolation date
definition: A culture isolation date is a date-time entity marking the end of a process in which a sample yields a positive result for the target microbial analyte(s) in the form of an isolated colony or colonies.

label: food cleaning process
definition: The process of cleaning food to separate other environmental materials from the food source. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.
valueSyntax: [drum and drain|manual spinner|rinsed with sanitizer solution|rinsed with water|scrubbed with brush|scrubbed with hand|soaking]

label: collection site geographic feature
definition: Text or terms that describe the geographic feature where the food sample was obtained by the researcher. This field accepts selected terms listed under the following ontologies: anthropogenic geographic feature (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000002), for example agricultural fairground [ENVO:01000986]; garden [ENVO:00000011} or any of its subclasses; market [ENVO:01000987]; water well [ENVO:01000002]; or human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070).

label: food product type
definition: A food product type is a class of food products that is differentiated by its food composition (e.g., single- or multi-ingredient), processing and/or consumption characteristics. This does not include brand name products but it may include generic food dish categories. This field accepts terms under food product type (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON:03400361). For terms related to food product for an animal, consult food product for animal (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03309997). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food type. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

label: fermentation chemical additives
definition: Any chemicals that are added to the fermentation process to achieve the desired final product.

label: fermentation chemical additives percentage
definition: The amount of chemical added to the fermentation process.

label: fermentation headspace oxygen
definition: The amount of headspace oxygen in a fermentation vessel.

label: fermentation medium
definition: The growth medium used for the fermented food fermentation process, which supplies the required nutrients.  Usually this includes a carbon and nitrogen source, water, micronutrients and chemical additives.

label: fermentation pH
definition: The pH of the fermented food fermentation process.

label: fermentation relative humidity
definition: The relative humidity of the fermented food fermentation process.

label: fermentation temperature
definition: The temperature of the fermented food fermentation process.

label: fermentation time
definition: The time duration of the fermented food fermentation process.

label: fermentation vessel
definition: The type of vessel used for containment of the fermentation.

label: bacteria density
definition: Number of bacteria in sample, as defined by bacteria density (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0000043).
example: 10 colony forming units per gram dry weight
preferredUnit: colony forming units per milliliter; colony forming units per gram of dry weight

label: food stored by consumer (storage duration)
definition: The storage duration of the food commodity by the consumer, prior to onset of illness or sample collection.  Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format.

label: food stored by consumer (storage temperature)
definition: Temperature at which food commodity was stored by the consumer, prior to onset of illness or sample collection.

label: purchase date
definition: The date a food product was purchased by consumer.

label: quantity purchased
definition: The quantity of food purchased by consumer.

label: dietary claim or use
definition: These descriptors are used either for foods intended for special dietary use as defined in 21 CFR 105 or for foods that have special characteristics indicated in the name or labeling. This field accepts terms listed under dietary claim or use (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510023). Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes, but please consider limiting this list to the most prominent dietary claim or use.

label: food additive
definition: A substance or substances added to food to maintain or improve safety and freshness, to improve or maintain nutritional value, or improve taste, texture and appearance.  This field accepts terms listed under food additive (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03412972). Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes, but please consider limiting this list to the top 5 ingredients listed in order as on the food label.  See also, https://www.fda.gov/food/food-ingredients-packaging/overview-food-ingredients-additives-colors.

label: food allergen labeling
definition: A label indication that the product contains a recognized allergen. This field accepts terms listed under dietary claim or use (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510213).
example: food allergen labelling about crustaceans and products thereof [FOODON:03510215]

label: food cooking process
definition: The transformation of raw food by the application of heat. This field accepts terms listed under food cooking (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03450002).

label: food distribution point geographic location
definition: A reference to a place on the Earth, by its name or by its geographical location that refers to a distribution point along the food chain. This field accepts terms listed under geographic location (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GAZ_00000448). Reference: Adam Diamond, James Barham. Moving Food Along the Value Chain: Innovations in Regional Food Distribution. U.S. Dept. of Agriculture, Agricultural Marketing Service. Washington, DC. March 2012. http://dx.doi.org/10.9752/MS045.03-2012.
example: USA: Delmarva Peninsula or USA: Georgia, Atlanta [GAZ:00004445]

label: food distribution point geographic location (city)
definition: A reference to a place on the Earth, by its name or by its geographical location that refers to a distribution point along the food chain. This field accepts terms listed under geographic location (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GAZ_00000448). Reference: Adam Diamond, James Barham. Moving Food Along the Value Chain: Innovations in Regional Food Distribution. U.S. Dept. of Agriculture, Agricultural Marketing Service. Washington, DC. March 2012. http://dx.doi.org/10.9752/MS045.03-2012.

label: food ingredient
definition: In this field, please list individual ingredients for multi-component food [FOODON:00002501] and simple foods that is not captured in food_type.  Please use terms that are present in FoodOn.  Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes |, but please consider limiting this list to the top 5 ingredients listed in order as on the food label.  See also, https://www.fda.gov/food/food-ingredients-packaging/overview-food-ingredients-additives-colors.

label: food product name legal status
definition: A datum indicating that use of a food product name is regulated in some legal jurisdiction. This field accepts terms listed under food product name legal status (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530087).

label: food product origin geographic location
definition: A reference to a place on the Earth, by its name or by its geographical location that describes the origin of the food commodity, either in terms of its cultivation or production. This field accepts terms listed under geographic location (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GAZ_00000448).

label: food package capacity
definition: The maximum number of product units within a package

label: food packing medium integrity
definition: A term label and term id to describe the state of the packing material and text to explain the exact condition.  This field accepts terms listed under food packing medium integrity (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530218).

label: material of contact prior to food packaging
definition: The material the food contacted (e.g., was processed in) prior to packaging. This field accepts terms listed under material of contact prior to food packaging (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530077). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the material of contact prior to food packaging.

label: food production system characteristics
definition: Descriptors of the food production system or of the agricultural environment and growing conditions related to the farm production system, such as wild caught, organic, free-range, industrial, dairy, beef,  domestic or cultivated food production. This field accepts terms listed under food production (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530206). Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes.

label: food product synonym
definition: Other names by which the food product is known by (e.g., regional or non-English names).

label: food product by quality
definition: Descriptors for describing food visually or via other senses, which is useful for tasks like food inspection where little prior knowledge of how the food came to be is available. Some terms like food (frozen) are both a quality descriptor and the output of a process. This field accepts terms listed under food product by quality (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_00002454).

label: food traceability list category
definition: The FDA is proposing to establish additional traceability recordkeeping requirements (beyond what is already required in existing regulations) for persons who manufacture, process, pack, or hold foods the Agency has designated for inclusion on the Food Traceability List. The Food Traceability List (FTL) identifies the foods for which the additional traceability records described in the proposed rule would be required. The term Food Traceability List (FTL) refers not only to the foods specifically listed (https://www.fda.gov/media/142303/download), but also to any foods that contain listed foods as ingredients.
valueSyntax: [cheeses-other than hard cheeses|cucumbers|crustaceans|finfish-including smoked finfish|fruits and vegetables-fresh cut|herbs-fresh|leafy greens-including fresh cut leafy greens|melons|mollusks-bivalves|nut butter|peppers|ready to eat deli salads|sprouts|tomatoes|tropical tree fruits|shell eggs]

label: Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP) guide food safety term
definition: Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP) food safety terms; This field accepts terms listed under HACCP guide food safety term (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530221).

label: microbiological culture medium
definition: A culture medium used to select for, grow, and maintain prokaryotic microorganisms. Can be in either liquid (broth) or solidified (e.g. with agar) forms. This field accepts terms listed under microbiological culture medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MICRO_0000067). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the culture medium.

label: microbial starter
definition: Any type of microorganisms used in food production.  This field accepts terms listed under live organisms for food production (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_0344453).

label: microbial starter organism count
definition: Total cell count of starter culture per gram, volume or area of sample and the method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) should also be provided. (example : total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qPCR).
example: total prokaryotes;3.5e9 colony forming units per milliliter;spread plate
preferredUnit: colony forming units per milliliter; colony forming units per gram of dry weight

label: microbial starter inoculation
definition: The amount of starter culture used to inoculate a new batch.

label: microbial starter preparation
definition: Information about the protocol or method used to prepare the starter inoculum.
example: liquid starter culture, propagated 3 cycles in milk prior to inoculation

label: microbial starter source
definition: The source from which the microbial starter culture was sourced.  If commercially supplied, list supplier.

label: microbial starter NCBI taxonomy ID
definition: Please include Genus species and strain ID, if known of microorganisms used in food production. For complex communities, pipes can be used to separate two or more microbes.

label: nucleic acid extraction kit
definition: The name of the extraction kit used to recover the nucleic acid fraction of an input material is performed.
expectedValue: The name of an extraction kit

label: number of samples collected
definition: The number of samples collected during the current sampling event.

label: sample collection method
definition: The method employed for collecting the sample.

label: biological sample replicate
definition: Measurements of biologically distinct samples that show biological variation.

label: technical sample replicate
definition: Repeated measurements of the same sample that show independent measures of the noise associated with the equipment and the protocols.

label: sample storage device
definition: The container used to store the  sample. This field accepts terms listed under container (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C43186). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the storage device.

label: sample storage media
definition: The liquid that is added to the sample collection device prior to sampling. If the sample is pre-hydrated, indicate the liquid media the sample is pre-hydrated with for storage purposes. This field accepts terms listed under microbiological culture medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MICRO_0000067). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the sample storage media.

label: sample transport  container
definition: Conatiner in which the sample was stored during transport. Indicate the location name.

label: sample transport duration
definition: The duration of time from when the sample was collected until processed. Indicate the duration for which the sample was stored written in ISO 8601 format.

label: sample transport temperature
definition: Temperature at which sample was transported, e.g. -20 or 4 degree Celsius.

label: specific intended consumer
definition: Food consumer type, human or animal, for which the food product is produced and marketed. This field accepts terms listed under food consumer group (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510136).

label: antimicrobial phenotype of spike-in bacteria
definition: Qualitative description of a microbial response to antimicrobial agents. Bacteria may be susceptible or resistant to a broad range of antibiotic drugs or drug classes, with several intermediate states or phases. This field accepts terms under antimicrobial phenotype (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ARO_3004299).

label: study design
definition: A plan specification comprised of protocols (which may specify how and what kinds of data will be gathered) that are executed as part of an investigation and is realized during a study design execution. This field accepts terms under study design (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0500000). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the study design. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

label: study incubation duration
definition: Sample incubation duration if unpublished or unvalidated method is used. Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format.

label: study incubation temperature
definition: Sample incubation temperature if unpublished or unvalidated method is used.

label: time-course duration
definition: For time-course research studies involving samples of the food commodity, indicate the total duration of the time-course study.

label: study treatment
definition: A process in which the act is intended to modify or alter some other material entity.  From the study design, each treatment is comprised of one level of one or multiple factors. This field accepts terms listed under treatment (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MCO_0000866). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the study treatment. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

label: food animal antimicrobial
definition: The name(s) (generic or brand) of the antimicrobial(s) given to the food animal within the last 30 days.

label: food animal antimicrobial duration
definition: The duration of time (days) that the antimicrobial was administered to the food animal.

label: food animal antimicrobial frequency
definition: The frequency per day that the antimicrobial was adminstered to the food animal.

label: food animal antimicrobial route of administration
definition: The route by which the antimicrobial is adminstered into the body of the food animal.

label: food animal antimicrobial intended use
definition: The prescribed intended use of or the condition treated by the antimicrobial given to the food animal by any route of administration.

label: food animal body condition
definition: Body condition scoring is a production management tool used to evaluate overall health and nutritional needs of a food animal. Because there are different scoring systems, this field is restricted to three categories.

label: food animal source sex category
definition: The sex and reproductive status of the food animal.

label: food source age
definition: The age of the food source host organim. Depending on the type of host organism, age may be more appropriate to report in days, weeks, or years.

label: facility type
definition: Establishment details about the type of facility where the sample was taken. This is independent of the specific product(s) within the facility.

label: hygienic food production area
definition: The subdivision of areas within a food production facility according to hygienic requirements. This field accepts terms listed under hygienic food production area (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). Please add a term that most accurately indicates the hygienic area your sample was taken from according to the definitions provided.

label: food production environmental monitoring zone
definition: An environmental monitoring zone is a formal designation as part of an environmental monitoring program, in which areas of a food production facility are categorized, commonly as zones 1-4, based on likelihood or risk of foodborne pathogen contamination. This field accepts terms listed under food production environmental monitoring zone (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). Please add a term to indicate the environmental monitoring zone the sample was taken from.

label: area sampled size
definition: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

label: sample surface moisture
definition: Degree of water held on a sampled surface.  If present, user can state the degree of water held on surface (intermittent moisture, submerged). If no surface moisture is present indicate not present.

label: sample location condition
definition: The condition of the sample location at the time of sampling.

label: biocide
definition: Substance intended for preventing, neutralizing, destroying, repelling, or mitigating the effects of any pest or microorganism; that inhibits the growth, reproduction, and activity of organisms, including fungal cells; decreases the number of fungi or pests present; deters microbial growth and degradation of other ingredients in the formulation. Indicate the biocide used on the location where the sample was taken. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.
expectedValue: commercial name of biocide, active ingredient in biocide or class of biocide

label: sampling room sterilization method
definition: The method used to sterilize the sampling room. This field accepts terms listed under electromagnetic radiation (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001026). If the proper descriptor is not listed, please use text to describe the sampling room sterilization method. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

label: soil horizon
definition: soil horizon is defined as the layer parallel to the soil surface whose physical, chemical and biological characteristics differ from the layers above and beneath. Horizon can be described both in absolute terms (particle size distribution for texture, for instance) and in terms relative to the surrounding material, i.e. ‘coarser’ or ‘sandier’ than the horizons above and below.
example: [O horizon|A horizon|E horizon|B horizon|C horizon|R layer|Permafrost]

label: photosynthetic activity
definition: Measurement of photosythetic activity (i.e. leaf gas exchange / chlorophyll fluorescence emissions / reflectance / transpiration) Please also include the term method term detailing the method of activity measurement.

label: observed host symbionts
definition: The taxonomic name of the organism(s) found living in mutualistic, commensalistic, or parasitic symbiosis with the specific host.

label: duration of association with the host
definition: Time spent in host of the symbiotic organism at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on symbiotic organism and study.

label: symbiotic host organism life cycle type
definition: Type of life cycle of the symbiotic host species (the thing being sampled). Simple life cycles occur within a single host, complex ones within multiple different hosts over the course of their normal life cycle.
expectedValue: type of life cycle of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples)

label: host of the symbiont role
definition: Role of the host in the life cycle of the symbiotic organism.

label: host number individual
definition: Number of symbiotic host individuals pooled at the time of collection.

label: host of the symbiotic host taxon id
definition: NCBI taxon id of the host of the symbiotic host organism.
expectedValue: NCBI taxon identifier of the host of the symbiotic taxon organism

label: type of symbiosis
definition: Type of biological interaction established between the symbiotic host organism being sampled and its respective host

label: host specificity
definition: Level of specificity of symbiont-host interaction: e.g. generalist (symbiont able to establish associations with distantly related hosts) or species-specific.

label: observed host symbionts
definition: The taxonomic name of the organism(s) found living in mutualistic, commensalistic, or parasitic symbiosis with the specific host. For cases when the specific host of the sample is a symbiont this field should refer to other organisms it is associated with. E.g.: hyperparasite species X (parasite of the parasite)
expectedValue: symbionts of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples). e.g.: annotating a sample collected from a trematode with a nematomorpha cyst consider: species name of the nematomorph; {species name} or {common name}

label: observed coinfecting organisms in host of host
definition: The taxonomic name of any coinfecting organism observed in a symbiotic relationship with the host of the sampled host organism. e.g. where a sample collected from a host trematode species (A) which was collected from a host_of_host fish (B) that was also infected with a nematode (C), the value here would be (C) the nematode {species name} or {common name}. Multiple co-infecting species may be added in a comma-separated list. For listing symbiotic organisms associated with the host (A) use the term Observed host symbiont.

label: mode of transmission
definition: The process through which the symbiotic host organism entered the host from which it was sampled.

label: host cellular location
definition: The localization of the symbiotic host organism within the host from which it was sampled: e.g. intracellular if the symbiotic host organism is localized within the cells or extracellular if the symbiotic host organism is localized outside of cells.

label: host dependence
definition: Type of host dependence for the symbiotic host organism to its host.

label: route of transmission
definition: Description of path taken by the symbiotic host organism being sampled in order to establish a symbiotic relationship with the host (with which it was observed at the time of sampling) via a mode of transmission (specified in mode_transmission).

label: sample storage solution
definition: Solution within which sample was stored, if any.

label: host subspecific genetic lineage
definition: Information about the genetic distinctness of the host organism below the subspecies level e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, variety, cultivar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.
expectedValue: Genetic lineage below lowest rank of NCBI taxonomy, which is subspecies, e.g. serovar, biotype, ecotype, variety, cultivar.

label: host of the symbiotic host disease status
definition: List of diseases with which the host of the symbiotic host organism has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at https://www.disease-ontology.org, non-human host diseases are free text.
expectedValue: disease name or Disease Ontology term

label: host of the symbiotic host common name
definition: Common name of the host of the symbiotic host organism.

label: host of the symbiotic host local environmental context
definition: For a symbiotic host organism the local anatomical environment within its host may have causal influences. Report the anatomical entity(s) which are in the direct environment of the symbiotic host organism being sampled and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. For example, if the symbiotic host organism being sampled is an intestinal worm, its local environmental context will be the term for intestine from UBERON (http://uberon.github.io/).
expectedValue: UBERON term(s), multiple values can be separated by pipes.

label: host of the symbiotic host environemental medium
definition: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the symbiotic host organism at the time of sampling. This usually will be a tissue or substance type from the host, but may be another material if the symbiont is external to the host. We recommend using classes from the UBERON ontology, but subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483) may also be used. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. intestines, heart).MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. intestines, heart).
expectedValue: An ontology term for a material such as a tissue type or excreted substance.

label: host of the symbiotic host subject id
definition: A unique identifier by which each host of the symbiotic host organism subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #H14.

label: host of the symbiotic host family relationship
definition: Familial relationship of the host of the symbiotic host organisms to other hosts of symbiotic host organism in the same study; can include multiple relationships.

label: host of the symbiotic host infra-specific name
definition: Taxonomic name information of the host of the symbiotic host organism below subspecies level.

label: host of the symbiotic host infra-specific rank
definition: Taxonomic rank information about the host of the symbiotic host organism below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc.

label: host of the symbiotic host genotype
definition: Observed genotype of the host of the symbiotic host organism.

label: host of the symbiotic host phenotype
definition: Phenotype of the host of the symbiotic host organism. For phenotypic quality ontology (PATO) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/pato.
expectedValue: phenotype of the host of the symbiotic organism; PATO

url.label: host of the symbiotic host gravidity
url.definition: Whether or not the host of the symbiotic host organism is gravid, and if yes date due or date post-conception, specifying which is used.

url.label: host of the symbiotic host total mass
url.definition: Total mass of the host of the symbiotic host organism at collection, the unit depends on the host.

url.label: spike-in organism count
url.definition: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) should also be provided (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qPCR).
url.example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 colony forming units per milliliter;qPCR
url.preferredUnit: colony forming units per milliliter; colony forming units per gram of dry weight

url.label: photosynthetic activity method
url.definition: Reference or method used in measurement of photosythetic activity
